brief_summary.textblock:
This two-part, open-label extension (OLE) and safety monitoring (SM) study will examine the
      efficacy and safety of continued etrolizumab treatment in moderate to severe ulcerative
      colitis (UC) patients previously enrolled in etrolizumab Phase III studies.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open-label Extension and Safety Study for Patients With Ulcerative Colitis Previously Enrolled in Etrolizumab Phase III Studies

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Part 1 (Open-label Extension)

          -  Patients previously enrolled in Phase III controlled studies who meet the eligibility
             criteria for open-label etrolizumab for those studies as described in the protocol

        Part 2 (Safety Monitoring)

          -  Patients who participated in one of the etrolizumab Phase III studies and are not
             eligible or chose not to enter Part 1 (OLE)

          -  Patients who transfer from Part 1 (OLE)

          -  Completion of the 12-week safety follow-up prior to entering.

        Exclusion Criteria:

        Part 1 (Open-label Extension)

          -  Any new, significant, uncontrolled condition

        Part 2 (Safety Monitoring)

          -  No exclusion criteria

intervention.description: 105 mg administered subcutaneously every 4 weeks for up to 7 years or until either commercial availability or the Sponsor's decision to terminate the study.

clinical_study.official_title: AN OPEN LABEL EXTENSION AND SAFETY MONITORING STUDY OF MODERATE TO SEVERE ULCERATIVE COLITIS PATIENTS PREVIOUSLY ENROLLED IN ETROLIZUMAB PHASE III STUDIES

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Long-term efficacy as determined by partial Mayo Clinic Score (pMCS)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
